anyone here able to help me troubleshoot: i've installed some new ram and now my pc wont boot
i've followed the procedure described in the manuals to the letter
yeah, tried that still the same
fans attempt to spin but dont
how comfortable are you inside a case?
im pretty confident, i've done a few self builds now
I would reseat the RAM for starters, if not I would reaseat the entire motherboard
if its grounded the result would be very similar to what you described
what should i look for to tell if its grounded ?
anything metal other than the standoffs touching the motherboard (like a loose screw) would do it
unplug all your drives, remove all your PCI cards (except video) and see if it boots then
if not take out all but one stick of RAM and try again
failing that, reseat (rebuilt) the entire system and try again
failing THAT you are facing hardware failure...
